meanings.definition: The fleshy muscular organ in the mouth used for tasting, swallowing, and speaking.
meanings.sent1: My tongue helps me taste delicious ice cream.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally bit her tongue while eating.
meanings.sent3: The tongue can be mischievous, sticking out at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: His words were sharp, like a tongue lashing.
meanings.sent5: The texture of the food was so strange, it felt like my tongue was on an adventure.

meanings.definition: A person's ability to speak or the way in which they speak.
meanings.sent1: Her tongue is very persuasive when she wants something.
meanings.sent2: He has a silver tongue that can charm anyone.
meanings.sent3: The politician's tongue was as smooth as butter during the speech.
meanings.sent4: His sharp tongue often gets him into trouble.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouraging words were like music to my ears, soothing my troubled tongue.

meanings.definition: A language or dialect spoken in a particular country or region.
meanings.sent1: English is the tongue spoken in many countries around the world.
meanings.sent2: She quickly picked up the local tongue when she moved abroad.
meanings.sent3: Learning a new tongue can be challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tongue of the tribe held secrets of their ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the foreign tongue danced in her ears, enchanting her with its beauty.
